article_title: The Impact Of Scalia's Vacancy On 5th Circ. Cases
article_text:
The Impact Of Scalia's Vacancy On 5th Circ. Cases

Law360, New York (March 25, 2016, 2:24 PM ET) -- So far, 10 cases from the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit are up for review this term in the U.S. Supreme Court. Two were decided before Justice Antonin Scalia died; eight remain undecided. And these eight undecided cases include some of the most high-profile, most politicized cases of the year — cases most people thought would divide the justices 5-4, along ideological lines. So what impact does Justice Scalia’s death have on these cases? What happens now that the court is potentially divided...

To view the full article, register now.

article_metadata.description: For several Fifth Circuit cases that are up for review in the U.S. Supreme Court, the absence of Justice Antonin Scalia will likely have a large impact. Jason Steed at Bell Nunnally & Martin LLP examines four of the biggest Fifth Circuit cases and how they could potentially be decided without Justice Scalia's vote.
